Room.Name: Goblin Library
Room.ShortDescription: You have found what might be called the goblin priest's library.
Room.LongDescription: Several goblins ignore your presense and continue to work, while others rise to object. You never imagined goblins could read or write, let alone have a library. Along the back wall are several shelves filled with both large and small books, many old scrolls and a few hefty and ancient tomes. A few wooden tables and chairs run the length of the room. Scattered atop the tables are piles of parchment, open books and writing instruments. Closer examination of the titles reveals that some of the books are written about magic and mages. They may contain the incantations and words for great spells, or perhaps directions to lost treasure. Too bad you don't read goblin. You also notice some of the books appear to be in elvin.
